p: Chloroquine (CQ) is a 4-aminoquinoline antimalarial agent that has proven anti-inflammatory and immunomodulatory activities. CQ also has anti-viral properties due to the following mechanisms: blocking virus/cell fusion; interfering with the glycosylation of cellular receptors, lysosomes and autophagosomes impairment; inhibiting viral enzymes (i.e. viral DNA and RNA polymerase); increasing pH of intracellular vesicles which interferes with pH-dependent viral replication [ [54], [55], [56]].
